With the number of COVID-19 cases increasing every day, psychologists offer insights on how to separate yourself from others, while still getting the social support you need.

Therapy for Black Girls
description: So often the stigma surrounding mental health issues and therapy prevents Black women from taking the step of seeing a therapist. company: International Institute for Animal Assisted Play Therapy
name: Pandemic Response for Mental Health & Play Therapists
description: This blogpost originated as a few posts on social media groups, but to make it more accessible to those interested, I am combining them here. Some of the material is pertinent to the United States, but much of it is relevant to anyone in a therapeutic capacity.

As the founder and CEO of a workplace mental health nonprofit and someone who manages generalized anxiety disorder, I’m already very attuned to the mental health of my team—but these are extraordinary times...
name: How To Lead With Mental Health In Mind During Coronavirus
Centre for Mindfulness Studies
description: Supporting our community during the Covid-19 by providing free and pay-what-you-can offerings

name: How to Cope With Quarantine
description: Quarantining yourself at home can play an important role in preventing the spread of infectious diseases. But this doesn’t mean that coping with the disruption in your normal routine is easy. Taking care of your mental health is essential, even if your time in quarantine is relatively brief...

This game guides you through a series of questions that help you practice self care. It's especially useful for people who struggle with self care, executive dysfunction, and/or reading internal signals. Take your time. Set aside some time—maybe an hour to allow yourself to work through each step.
name: You Feel Like Shit: A Self Care Game
Reimagining Recovery
description: Reimagining Recovery is offering FREE peer-led mutual aid meetings online every evening from 7-9 PM Pacific Standard Time. Go to link for full schedule and to see details on different topics and for Zoom link.

The Vault is home to intimate stories by women — our deepest thoughts, our darkest secrets, and our untold experiences worth sharing. They are offering one free story with code "TAKECARE" at checkout.
name: Vault Zine

description: Some of the HBR edit staff met virtually the other day — a screen full of faces in a scene becoming more common everywhere. We talked about the content we’re commissioning in this harrowing time of a pandemic and how we can help people. But we also talked about how we were feeling...
name: That Discomfort You’re Feeling Is Grief by Scott Berinato

description:

description: How this situation is affecting HSPs in unique ways and how they can cope.

description: There’s nothing to lose. Calling a suicide hotline is a great way to vent and get sound advice on how to deal with your problems. Please choose your country and call the appropriate number.

description: CACL will be sharing disability-related resources related to the COVID-19 pandemic on this page, pulled together in one spot for families. When you find reliable information or practices that may help other families, share it! And to be sure we see it, use #COVIDdisability.

Turn staying in into your at-home advantage. Start training with a personal plan that guides you—while adjusting to your progress, schedule and other activities. With NTC, you get access to four 4–6 week training plans.

description: Some of Shifu Yan Xin (34th generation Shaolin Disciple) asked him about what training we can do to keep our lungs strong and healthy, so Shifu has made this video, where he has designed 5 Shaolin Qi Gong movements that will help us to work on our lungs and strengthen it. 9:19 minutes (Youtube)
name: 5 Shaolin Qi Gong Breath Exercises to Strengthen the Lungs

description:
COMING SOON
App matching marginalized communities with compatible licensed therapists based on their unique experiences and identities across race, gender identity, class, sexuality, ethnicity, and ability. It allows for flexible, convenient and anonymous online communication
name: Ayana: Therapy for Marginalized & Intersectional Communities

description: Online platform that connects you to caring listeners for free emotional support 24/7; or be a listener for others
name: 7 Cups

description: Online therapy for individuals experiencing anxiety or depression, sliding scale available for those financially affected by COVID-19
name: Danielle Hulan Therapy & Counselling
Crisis Text Line
description:
💬 Text HOME to 741741 to connect with a Crisis Counselor (Canada/US)
Free 24/7 support at your fingertips
A live, trained Crisis Counselor receives the text and responds, all from our secure online platform.
The volunteer Crisis Counselor will help you move from a hot moment to a cool moment.

Many teams around the world are making a quick transition to remote work right now...we’ve been honing what works–and what doesn’t–for nine years of being a virtual workplace. At the core of feeling good as individuals and as a team, and at the core of doing good work, is trust..
name: Building Trust While Working Remotely
Subtle Asian Mental Health Facebook Group
description: Our hope for this group is to reach as many Asians struggling with mental health, cultural issues, inter-generational trauma, and associated problems as possible. Mental health is a growing issue among global Asian diaspora communities, but as Asians we tend to be brought up to not talk about it...

name: Flying Books (Book Store)
description: Flying Books is a bookshop nestled inside three different businesses in downtown Toronto. Rotating selections include fiction, memoirs, graphic novels, science, or history – always choosily chosen. Free, contactless delivery within Toronto only until April 30 with promo code AIRDROP.
Article on how to work remotely and still feel connected with your team during this time.
name: Working Remote & Feeling Connected During the Pandemic

description:
During these uncertain times of social distancing and self-quarantine, anxiety and stress are high for most people. However, youth with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) are particularly prone to distress in response to changes or disruptions in their typical routines. 
Article also available in Spanish.
name: Tips for Talking With Your Child With Autism About COVID-19

description: The aging population, ages 65 and older, is one of the most vulnerable demographic groups in the United States. The novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic puts seniors and their mental health at significant risk. Tips for how seniors can stay healthy and connected during the COVID-19 pandemic.
name: Senior Guide to Mental Health During Coronavirus (COVID-19)

company: CAMH (Centre for Addiction and Mental Health)
name: Mental Health and the COVID-19 Pandemic
description: A comprehensive guide for all things mental health from stress and anxiety, quarantine and isolation, and stigma and prejudice. Also resources for healthcare workers.

Cabin fever is a popular term for a relatively common reaction to being isolated in a building for a period of time. Some experts believe that cabin fever is a sort of syndrome, while others feel that it is linked to such disorders as seasonal affective disorder and claustrophobia...
name: Cabin Fever Symptoms and Coping Skills

description: Good Grief is a non-profit (US) that builds resilience in children, strengthens families, and empowers communities to grow from loss and adversity. Their website has a great compilation of COVID-related or grief-related resources and services. They are based in New Jersey, USA.
name: Good Grief

description: Therapists share the advice they give Asian American clients who are dealing with discrimination during the COVID-19 pandemic.
name: Self-Care Tips For Asian Americans Dealing With Racism...

description:
Canada's only 24/7 national support service. Text, Phone, Live Chat and Other resources for kids and youth. 
☎ 1-800-668-6868 to talk to a counsellor privately, no judgement, and confidential.
💬 Text CONNECT to 686868
English and French.
name: Kids Help Phone
Gerstein Crisis Centre
description:
24-hour community-based crisis services for adults 16+ in the City of Toronto who are dealing with mental health, concurrent, or substance use issues and are currently in crisis. 
☎ (416) 929-5200.

A passionate community around accessibility, diversity, transparency, hundreds of curated, high quality videos for all levels, and a world-class 250-hour Yoga Teacher Training. Offers free membership for those in need; For those quarantined by the coronavirus, contact them for 2 free months
name: DoYogaWithMe Video Yoga Classes
Digital Resilience in the Time of Coronavirus
description: A guide to transitioning your digital security culture to meet the moment.
During COVID-19, is offering sessions exclusively via phone and video, and offering pay-what-you-can sessions during this time
name: Britt Caron Therapy
The Yoga Room Youtube Channel
description: Various playlists of yoga sequences on Youtube for specific groups like folks with bigger bodies; accessible yoga for mobility issues, kids yoga, chair yoga, gentle yoga and therapeutic yoga.

Offers a 24-hour telephone and TTY crisis line to all woman who have experienced abuse. 

☎️ GTA: 416-863-0511
☎️ GTA TTY: 416-364-8762
☎️ TOLL-FREE: 1-866-863-0511
☎️ TOLL FREE TTY: 1-8666-863-7868
#SAFE (#7233) on your Bell, Rogers, Fido or Telus Mobile
name: Assaulted Women's Helpline

description: SAVYN provides guided square breathing exercises in Arabic and English to produce a calming response to anxiety. No experience is required. These sessions are free.
name: SAVYN: PTSD therapy made simple and accessible
3 Easy Mindfulness Exercises for Your Littles
description: Our children pick up on our emotions, and they too may have difficult feelings they don't know how to handle. One way to help them deal with uncomfortable thoughts and emotions is with mindfulness practice.
Below is a roundup of over 60 free resources that may be of help to you as a social worker, mental health professional and/or social work educator during the COVID-19 pandemic.
name: COVID-19 Resources for Social Workers and Therapists

description: An article by the And Also Too team: "Early this week, our team met to reflect on what we’ve learned about prioritizing care, accessibility, and our humanity while trying to create beautiful work in a remote context..."
name: Care-based Approaches to Remote Work

description: Consists of only 12 exercises to be done for 30 seconds, with 10 second breaks between each exercise. All you need is a chair and a wall. Repeat 2-3 circuits depending on how much time you have. Based on HICT (high intensity circuit training).
name: 7 Minutes Workout app

description: Offering individual online/phone therapy, and is able to offer sliding scale to individuals who are financially impacted by Covid-19
name: Yzobela Hyett
Nasima Salehe
description: I have immediate availability for virtual sessions- whether short term for support during our time of crisis or interest in long term support as we rise to the other side of this time of isolation. At this time of economic instability I am offering ‘pay-what-you-can’ or deferred payment to those who are facing financial uncertainty.

name: Free Weekly Design Documentaries
description: Filmmaker Gary Hustwit is streaming his documentaries free worldwide during the global COVID-19 crisis. Each Tuesday a new film will be posted on website.
Facebook group to share resources, and get digital support for PTSD & complex PTSD
name: Toronto Trauma Peer Support Network

description: Our therapists provide affordable, in-office and online psychotherapy sessions between $30 and $60 (between $30 and $80 for couples & family sessions)
name: Open Path Psychotherapy Collective

description: Human beings like certainty.  We are hard-wired to want to know what is happening when and to notice things that feel threatening to us.  When things feel uncertain or when we don’t generally feel safe, it’s normal to feel stressed...
name: Taking Care of Your Mental Health in the Face of Uncertainty
Choosing sources of COVID-19 info carefully is critical
description: With guidance from Dr. Keith Dobson, clinical psychologist and professor at the University of Calgary, the Mental Health Commission of Canada has compiled the following tips to help Canadians protect their mental health as they strive to safeguard their physical well-being...

We offer support to anyone concerned about suicide. Whether you are suffering from a loss, worried about someone who may be having suicidal thoughts, or having suicidal thoughts yourself, our highly trained responders are there to provide support. 
☎ 1-833-456-4566
name: Crisis Services Canada
